p: The extract of N. sarnine bulbs showed strong larvicidal activity with an LC 50 value of 0.008 μg μL −1 against first instar Aedes aegypti larvae, and with an LD 50 value 4.6 μg/mosquito against adult female Ae. aegypti, which is the major vector of dengue and yellow fevers and the Zika virus. All the alkaloids were tested against Ae. aegypti and only crinsarnine ( 12) showed adulticidal activity with an LD 50 = 2.29 – 0.049 ± μg/mosquito [ 48], while sarniensine ( 10), at a concentration of 0.1 μg μL −1, exhibited strong adulticidal activity, with an LD 50 value of 1.38 ± 0.056 μg/mosquito [ 33].
